post:
Camera Manager: Collection of behaviors to imporve

I've made much progress with implementing a CameraManager support into the STorM32 gimbal controller to the point that it is practically usable, and in the practical tests I start to observe various behaviors of the camera manager GUI implementation which - IMHO - could be improved for better user friendliness. Instead of raising an issue for each, I thought I rather collect them here (pl tell if you prefer single issues for each). <strike>**1) Stream Selector field shown even if no STREAM capability** See #7450.</strike> EDIT: resolved **2) In photo mode single shot or interval mode should be indicated.** It's easy to forget what the last setting for the photo mode (single or interval) was, and not remembering it can lead to unexpected behavior. I thus suggest to have a graphical element on the GUI's "frontpage" showing this. E..g. this often seen "multiple-clocks" graphics. I would suggest to extend this to a "submode" concept. Cameras like the GoPro e.g. support several submodes for each video and photo, single or interval would then be seen as submodes. For the same reasons it would be highly useful if the camera's submode would be easily visible to the user. This may cause an issue for submodes for which the GUI/GCS doesn't have a graphics to represent, but this should be solvable, and be it that in this case the GUI doesn't show a graphics. <strike>**3) Don't allow changes of camera mode (photo vs video) while a video is recording or a a photo interval is running.** Currently that's possible, and results in strange states for the red button.</strike> EDIT: done <strike>**4) In photo mode provide a graphical feedback when the next photo can be taken.** In photo mode with single shots the response is very slow, i.e. it takes few seconds before the next photo can be taken. If a hit on the red button was successful currently can only be inferred indirectly through an increasing number of photos. I suggest to provide some graphical mechanism to show to the user when it is ready for the next shot. E.g., the red button could get square, and round again when ready for the next shot.</strike> EDIT: resolved **5) Clarify the behavior and relationship as regards CAM_MODE and CAMERA_CAP_FLAGS.** Depending on the capability flags and the existence of a CAM_MODE parameter various GUI configurations result. However, not all combinations lead to what I would consider the expected configuration and behavior of the GUI. E.g. from the description for the CAMERA_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_MODES flag I would have expected that with CAMERA_CAP_FLAGS_CAPTURE_VIDEO + CAMERA_CAP_FLAGS_CAPTURE_IMAGE but no CAMERA_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_MODES and no CAM_MODE parameter the GUI would still show video and photo modes, which is not the case. <strike>**6) Display available capacity with space between value and unit.** Don't display '5.7GB' but '5.7 GB'. Or even better display '5.71 GB'. Also, values in the MB range are cut to integer, e.g. a value of 7.8xxx is displayed as 7.0MB.</strike> EDIT: done **7) Don't request parameters twice.** Upon connection and startup of the camera manager the parameters are requested twice. It seems once when the component is detected and then a second time when the camera manager starts. **8) Don't give up with requesting CAMERA_CAPTURE_STATUS during video.** When recording a video is on, QGC requests CAMERA_CAPTURE_STATUS every 5 secs, but stops with doing so if a response is not received. I suggest to keep on, to allow for responses to be missed every once in a while. **9) Behave gracefully if camera isn't in a "I'm OK" state** It can happen that a camera experiences an issue, the GUI should behave gracefully then. The heartbeat's system_status field would be the canonical source of information for this, and the camera GUI should at least to some extend adjust its behavior to that. For instance, the critical/emergency states could be reasonable states for a camera to indicate issues. To give a specific practical example: A camera may miss a SD card or low battery and thus couldn't record, take photos, report memory size, and so on. The camera may then not be able to fill it's mavlink parameters with reasonable values, etc.. **10) Separate GUI for Camera Manager** It is somewhat annoying, and often leads to practical issues, that telemetry and camera can't be seen/accessed simultaneously. It would be highly useful if the camera manager GUI would be it's own GUI element. I mention #7540, which goes along similar lines. **11) Ensure that "fields" are consistent on init** It can happen that things are out of sync at init. For instance: I have a camera definition file now which makes use of excludes to select out parameters depending on CAM_MODE being video or photo. The GUI starts with the button in Video, according to the CAM_MODE parameter, but when looking at the parameters those for photo are selected. When I change the mode to photo and back to video, all is OK. This sort of startup inconsistencies I've observed in more instances, but can remember all. **12) Timing of initial param read and camera requests very harsh** Located in extra issue. **Miscellaneous** * when changing from photo to video the displayed available memory is shown as 0, not the actual value Thx for all your work on this, the CameraManager is really super cool.
question: Could you share your configuration xml file so that we see how you're using it?
answer: 6) Display available capacity with space between value and unit. Don't display '5.7GB' but '5.7 GB' 7) Don't request parameters twice Upon connection and startup of the camera manager the parameters are requested twice. It seems once when the component is detected and then a second time when the camera manager starts.

while query from edge based on many conditions We create two collection ，one named user used to store user info ，the other named tag used to store tags we designed . we also create a edge to store the relation between each tag and user ,including the weight about the tag to each user . Now ,we have 500 tags and 60000000 users and more than 250 million relationData in edge . the data like that :  we have 250 million data in edge named relation and it cost more than 3 minutes to return the result. sometimes it will shutdown or throw an error like that couldn't find shard "" for cluster ..... it caused by hardware ? or we used arangodb in wrong way ? 3 servers for cluster Configuration of each machine - centos6.9 - 64G Ram - 1T disk - Gigabit Ethernet / Transmission speed between machines 109M/s query aql like  thanks for your help
question: Maybe the optimizer doesn't pull out the concat invokation? You probably want a separate hash index for _from
answer: 3 servers for cluster Configuration of each machine centos6.9 64G Ram 1T disk Gigabit Ethernet Transmission speed between machines 109M/s query aql like for tag in [a,b,c] for relation in pc_portrait_relation filter relation._from == concat("pc_portrait_tag/",tag) return distinct relation._to thanks for your help

post:
Index not found error even though index exists, zombie doc in collection

## My Environment * __ArangoDB Version__: 3.5.3 * __Storage Engine__: RocksDB * __Deployment Mode__: Cluster * __Deployment Strategy__: Kubernetes * __Configuration__: 3 agents, 2 coordinators, 3 db nodes * __Infrastructure__: Azure AKS-Engine * __Operating System__: Ubuntu 18.04 * __Total RAM in your machine__: 32Gb * __Disks in use__: SSD * __Used Package__: Docker - official ## Component, Query & Data __Affected feature__: AQL traversal in cluster __AQL query (if applicable)__:  __AQL explain (if applicable)__:  When I modify the query to use INBOUND instead of ANY here is the plan:  The query with INBOUND completes in 300-500 ms, the query with ANY seems to have an infinite runtime. Note that this graph does not have any OUTBOUND edges from any node in the f vertex collection. __Dataset__: 245,000 documents in the f vertex collection 214,000 documents in the d vertex collection 214,000 documents in the d_edges edge collection 16,100,000 documents in the s vertex collection 16,100,000 documents in the s_edges edge collection __Size of your Dataset on disk__: I don't know __Replication Factor & Number of Shards (Cluster only)__: Replication factor is 3 for all vertex and edge collections There is 1 shard for all vertex and edge collections ## Steps to reproduce 1. Run the query above on this dataset, it will likely be very slow and may cause the server to return the "index not found" error for many queries (not just this query) if run enough times __Problem__: I have the following error from ArangoDB 3.5.3, upon trying to run a query which seems to be stuck running forever. The query is showing in the Slow Queries log with a runtime of 169,650 seconds (so far). The only errors I see in my application logs are:  Index '214730889' is indeed an index used by that query, but it definitely exists, so that message makes no sense whatsoever. Note that in my case the query in question was a graph traversal relative to a specific object specified by _key that did ANY instead of INBOUND so it seems like it was scanning a massive dataset. Changing it to INBOUND and the query completes in less than half a second. However, this appears to be a problem in the graph query execution plan, because if the query just looked at the edges related to that vertex, it could have discarded the non-existing OUTBOUND connections immediately, so it should have been trivial extra work for this query execution to work with ANY. Finally, even after the query was "fixed" to workaround the "infinite runtime" issue, the db server was still responding with the same "'Could not find index '214730889' in collection 's3010751'.' (while optimizing plan)" until the db server node was restarted. At that point ArangoDB resumed normal operation. So to summarize three issues here: 1) Spurious error in the logs related to a missing index that is not missing at all, and 2) A faulty execution plan for a graph traversal query resulting in seemingly infinite runtime, and the spurious error already mentioned. 3) Somehow this (or something else?) corrupted the db server, causing the same error even on other queries, until the db server was restarted. __Expected result__: ArangoDB should always be aware of the existing indexes and not suddenly report one as missing.

post:
Cache-Tree is not properly cleared when updating Block-Elements

# Bug Report <!-- - [/] Do not submit reports for unsupported versions, supported versions can be viewed here https://github.com/pimcore/pimcore/milestones - [/] This is not a security issue / vulnerability -> use [this form](https://pimcorehq.wufoo.com/forms/pimcore-security-report/) instead - [/] Behavior is reproducible on https://demo.pimcore.fun/admin/ (admin/demo) or on a clean install of the latest build (out of your project, to avoid problems with custom code, plugins, ...) - [ ] You're not able to fix the problem yourself and send us a pull request instead of filing an issue. - [/] There's no existing ticket for the same issue - [/] Remove unused sections from below and this bullet points, submit only clean reports - [ ] You're not able to fix the problem yourself and send us a pull request instead of filing an issue. ## Please answer the following questions --> ### Setup: Following Data-Objects: - ObjectA - ObjectB - Blocks - BlockElement - ObjectC - Relation to ObjectB I make changes to the BlockElement BlockElement->setTitle('title')->save(); ### Expected behavior Saving (no difference, whether i save through web or php-api) the BlockElement, then accessing the values of BlockElement from either ObjectA or ObjectC shows the updated values ObjectC->getObjectB()->"getBlocks()"->getBlockElement()->getTitle() === 'title'; ### Actual behavior Saving (no difference, whether i save through web or php-api) the BlockElement, then accessing the values of BlockElement from either ObjectA or ObjectC shows the old value, pre-update ObjectC->getObjectB()->"getBlocks()"->getBlockElement()->getTitle() !== 'title'; ObjectC->getObjectB()->"getBlocks()"->getBlockElement()->getTitle() === 'previousTitle'; ### Reason: I narrowed the saving process down: - while saving, the BlockElement clears the cache of the Parent - it does not however "inform" the related objects about this change. My Workaround so far is, that i get the CacheTags and clear manually: - ObjectA - ObjectB - ObjectC Doing that manually feels wrong to me, thus here i am opening this issue. What could be a better way of solving this issue?

post:
How to resolve not showing lint message sometimes

As the above title says, I have been running into the issue above for some time. After google search and debugging, I find that the wrapped [async function](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Statements/async_function) is the source of evil. you might say that why don't you get rid of the wrapped [async function](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Statements/async_function). It's because that we need to add lint support for experimental syntax([top-level-await](https://github.com/tc39/proposal-top-level-await)) to JavaScript code inside [CodeMirror](https://codemirror.net) . However, [babel-eslint](https://github.com/babel/babel-eslint) doesn't officially support browser targets. Therefore the wrapped async function is an awkward workaround. [Here](https://github.com/liuliangsir/codemirror-lint-eslint) is a minimal reproducible example, And the following is some code snippet.  Here are a bunch of GIFs. ![CodeMirror_-Linter-Demo-Google-Chrome-2020-04-22-14-58-44](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8049878/79951256-f05aa300-84aa-11ea-8d54-6a9fff70cd03.gif)
question: Can it be reproduced without involving ESLint?
answer: Here is a bunch of GIFs ![CodeMirror_-Linter-Demo-Google-Chrome-2020-04-22-14-58-44](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8049878/79951256-f05aa300-84aa-11ea-8d54-6a9fff70cd03.gif)

post:
'Socket hang up' errors started occurring consistently (but intermittently on different tests/steps) after 8-11 sceanarios in a wdio-cucumber-framework feature file

The following 'socket hang up' error occurs on different steps starting on the 8th to 11th scenario in a given feature file, where the previous scenarios, usually with the same sequence of steps as the failing one, run fine. Up until last November, all were running fine and passing, for ~1yr. The subsequent 4 tests also fail with 'socket hang up', while the following few tests will fail with error 'A session id is required for this command but wasn't found in the response payload', and then will start passing again. A new session is started with each scenario, as browser.reload() gets called on starting a scenario. The initial 'socket hang up' error occurs usually 4-5 steps into the scenario, while subsequent ones occur on the first step of the scenario. This is on Chrome, and was working perfectly until ~last November. Similar intermittent 'A session id is required for this command but wasn't found in the response payload' errors had always occurred on IE10 and IE11 (with no 'socket hang up'). Concurrent with the error, a browser window gets opened but doesn't get resized or attempt to navigate to the application url, and stays open while new windows get generated for new scenarios. It happens with every feature file run, both using selenium-standalone locally, wdio testrunner and Selenium Grid Extras via Jenkins. "Error: socket hang up at createHangUpError (_http_client.js:302:15) at Socket.socketOnEnd (_http_client.js:394:23) at emitNone (events.js:91:20) at Socket.emit (events.js:186:7) at endReadableNT (_stream_readable.js:974:12) at _combinedTickCallback (internal/process/next_tick.js:74:11) at process._tickDomainCallback (internal/process/next_tick.js:122:9)" **Environment (please complete the following information):** selenium-standalone 3.141.0 - **WebdriverIO version:** 4.8.0 - **Mode:** Both - **If WDIO Testrunner, running sync/async:** sync - **Node.js version:** 8.9.0 - **NPM version:** 5.6.0 - **Browser name and version:** Chrome 71.0.3578.98 --Driver: Chromedriver 2.45.0 - **Platform name and version:** Any : Windows 10, Windows 8.1 - **Additional wdio packages used (if applicable):** wdio-cucumber-framework: 1.1.0 **Additional context** Add any other context about the problem here. With chromedriver versions <=2.43, the following concurrent error also occurs in the selenium log as noted below, with trace: "java.lang.IllegalStateException: Committed". With chromedriver 2.45, the same 'Socket hang up' error occurs as the step error in the wdio output, but the java.lang.illegalStateException: Committed is not output, and instead the selenium-standalone log shows multiple sessions created and removed without intervening output, as follows: Starting ChromeDriver 2.45.615291 (ec3682e3c9061c10f26ea9e5cdcf3c53f3f74387) on port 42068 Only local connections are allowed. 15:51:45.018 INFO [ProtocolHandshake.createSession] - Detected dialect: OSS 15:51:45.033 INFO [RemoteSession$Factory.lambda$performHandshake$0] - Started new session ee949d62bb60cec80c97246fe5f21c13 (org.openqa.selenium.chrome.ChromeDriverService) 15:51:45.506 INFO [ProtocolHandshake.createSession] - Detected dialect: OSS 15:51:45.538 INFO [RemoteSession$Factory.lambda$performHandshake$0] - Started new session ff3758d7f2582b39ee02e3f6657ebabd (org.openqa.selenium.chrome.ChromeDriverService) 15:51:46.887 INFO [ProtocolHandshake.createSession] - Detected dialect: OSS 15:51:46.921 INFO [RemoteSession$Factory.lambda$performHandshake$0] - Started new session 40e0db5140996cd8a2e044f1901aeea6 (org.openqa.selenium.chrome.ChromeDriverService) 15:51:52.438 INFO [ActiveSessions$1.onStop] - Removing session This corresponds to logger output of messages being logged in before and after-scenario hooks, like "in beforeScenario in afterScenario in beforeScenario in afterScnenario" without intervening logging, which normally occurs while a scenario is executed. (The 'Socket hang up' error is output at then end of the run, as the Step/scenario error trace). With the 'code to reproduce' zip file, as the application being tested is not available due to a firewall, a different baseUrl (with a valid server) is substituted. In this case the 'Socket hang up' error is not, unfortunately, reproduced, but the same behavior with intermittent scenarios being aborted with an 'ECONNECT refused' error and a blank browser generated, while other scenarios attempt to get executed and only fail when failing to find specified selectors. Allure-report.zip where, if you filter out all passing and failed TCs, you can see each feature file with >9 scenarios hits the 'socket hang up' at TC8,9,10,11 or12: [allure-report.zip](https://github.com/webdriverio/webdriverio/files/2828491/allure-report.zip)
question: Can you try with the latest WebdriverIO version? Also could you provide all logs that are available to you?
answer: . Concurrent with the error, a browser window gets opened but doesn't get resized or attempt to navigate to the application url, and stays open while new windows get generated for new scenarios With chromedriver versions <=2.43, the following concurrent error also occurs in the selenium log as noted below, with trace: "java.lang.IllegalStateException: Committed". With chromedriver 2.45, the same 'Socket hang up' error occurs as the step error in the wdio output, but the java.lang.illegalStateException: Committed is not output, and instead the selenium-standalone log shows multiple sessions created and removed without intervening output, as follows: Starting ChromeDriver 2.45.615291 (ec3682e3c9061c10f26ea9e5cdcf3c53f3f74387) on port 42068 Only local connections are allowed. 15:51:45.018 INFO [ProtocolHandshake.createSession] - Detected dialect: OSS 15:51:45.033 INFO [RemoteSession$Factory.lambda$performHandshake$0] - Started new session ee949d62bb60cec80c97246fe5f21c13 (org.openqa.selenium.chrome.ChromeDriverService) 15:51:45.506 INFO [ProtocolHandshake.createSession] - Detected dialect: OSS 15:51:45.538 INFO [RemoteSession$Factory.lambda$performHandshake$0] - Started new session ff3758d7f2582b39ee02e3f6657ebabd (org.openqa.selenium.chrome.ChromeDriverService) 15:51:46.887 INFO [ProtocolHandshake.createSession] - Detected dialect: OSS 15:51:46.921 INFO [RemoteSession$Factory.lambda$performHandshake$0] - Started new session 40e0db5140996cd8a2e044f1901aeea6 (org.openqa.selenium.chrome.ChromeDriverService) 15:51:52.438 INFO [ActiveSessions$1.onStop] - Removing session This corresponds to logger output of messages being logged in before and after-scenario hooks, like "in beforeScenario in afterScenario in beforeScenario in afterScnenario" without intervening logging, which normally occurs while a scenario is executed. post:
TLS 1.3: javax.net.ssl.SSLException: No PSK available. Unable to resume.

9.4.12.v20180830 openjdk version "11" 2018-09-25 OpenJDK Runtime Environment 18.9 (build 11+28) OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM 18.9 (build 11+28, mixed mode) When running against Java 11 I get this exception when making HTTPS requests:  I don't have a minimal testcase but I'm hoping the above stacktrace gives you enough information to figure out what is going on. I never got this exception with Java 10 so I think it is specific to Java 11. Workaround: Disable TLS 1.3 using the following JVM property -Djdk.tls.client.protocols="TLSv1,TLSv1.1,TLSv1.2"
question: What is your SslContextFactory configuration? Can you get us a [Server.dump()](https://www.eclipse.org/jetty/documentation/current/jetty-dump-tool.html)?
answer: Workaround: Run application with -Djdk.tls.client.protocols="TLSv1,TLSv1.1,TLSv1.2"

Object reference not set to an instance of an object. **_Data View_** Data View showing that there are more than 3 lines in the data view: ![phone2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4658177/47012606-0e9e5f00-d1a1-11e8-80d0-96f7cb761da6.jpg) **_Report showing incomplete results and error message_** ![phone1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4658177/47012619-152cd680-d1a1-11e8-9c19-69b2fbcb1b87.jpg) Removing the PhoneNumber fields removes the warning, and the report lists the complete result set. ### Steps to Reproduce In version 8.3 1. Run the report. **Expected behavior:** The report should list all the rows that are in the data set, and any phone numbers should correctly show. The second parameter of the | Attribute filter appears to be ignored entirely. ### Steps to Reproduce (example 1) 1. Create a Global Attribute, with field type Attribute. Specify Person as the entity type. For this example, I used "Current Opt in Attribute" as the name. 1. Edit the value - it's essentially an attribute picker. Choose "Currently An eRA" or another attribute with spaces in the name. Save 1. Run the following Lava:  This returns "Currently An eRA" (the name) rather than "CurrentlyAneRA" (the key, as requested) Likewise,  returns "Currently An eRA" ### Steps to Reproduce (example 2) 1. Create a Person Attribute, with field type Attribute. Specify Person as the entity type. For this example, I used "Favorite Attribute" as the name. Assign it to a category, such as "Membership" 1. Visit a person's profile and on the Extended Attributes tab, edit Favorite Attribute by selecting "Baptized Here" or another attribute with spaces in the name. Save. 1. On their profile page, provide a block with the following Lava:  This returns rather than the Key (BaptizedHere) or the object properties enumerated in JSON. ### Additional notes: Other attributes, when provided with a bad value for the second attribute filter parameter, will return an empty string. For instance, assume you created a Person type Global attribute: {{ 'Global' | Attribute:'SeniorPastor','NotAValidProperty' }} returns "". But in example 1 above, {{ 'Global' | Attribute:'CurrentOptinAttribute','NotAValidProperty' }} still returns Currently An eRA. ### Versions * **Rock Version:** 7.5-8.2 * **Client Culture Setting:** EN-US

post:
[XAudio2] GC causing audio glitches

I have noticed that audio playback is sometimes glitching in a WindowsDX mode. It seems that GC is blocking XAudio2 thread. Which is a problem, if there is any audio playing during level loading or screen transitions when a new content is being loaded and a new objects are being created. I have narrowed the problem down to SharpDX wrapper. I have also tried the new [Vortice](https://github.com/amerkoleci/Vortice.Windows) wrapper, but it also glitches. Both are using [SharpGenTools](https://github.com/SharpGenTools/SharpGenTools) so this may be the source of the issue. I couldn't test this more as I can't get SharpGenTools to run under VS2019. I did create a simple custom wrapper that shows XAudio2 can run with managed wrapper without being affected by GC. The source for all tests is here: https://github.com/Jure-BB/XAudio2_GlitchTest What would be the preferred way to fix this issue in MonoGame? Fixing the discontinued SharpDX or fixing and the new Vortice wrapper and replacing SharpDX in MG or creating a custom wrapper just for the specific XAudio2 features that MonoGame needs? UPDATE: This is caused because MG/SharpDX registers for callbacks in XAudio engine. Check [this post](https://github.com/MonoGame/MonoGame/issues/7000#issuecomment-578434940) for details.
question: Where are the issues? I can fix it in my vortice project
answer: UPDATE: This is caused because MG/SharpDX registers for callbacks in XAudio engine. Check [this post](https://github.com/MonoGame/MonoGame/issues/7000#issuecomment-578434940) for details.

A PHP 5.4+ library for generating RFC 4122 version 1, 3, 4, and 5 universally unique identifiers (UUID). sensiolabs/security-checker v5.0.3 A security checker for your composer.lock silverstripe/graphql-devtools dev-master d73f56c Tools to help developers building new applications on SilverStripeâs GraphQL API silverstripe/postgresql 2.2.0 SilverStripe now has tentative support for PostgreSQL ('Postgres') silverstripe/recipe-cms 4.3.0 SilverStripe recipe for fully featured page and asset content editing silverstripe/recipe-plugin 1.3.0 Helper plugin to install SilverStripe recipes squizlabs/php_codesniffer 3.4.2 PHP_CodeSniffer tokenizes PHP, JavaScript and CSS files and detects violations of a defined set of coding standards. symbiote/silverstripe-gridfieldextensions 3.2.1 A collection of useful grid field components symbiote/silverstripe-queuedjobs 4.4.0 A framework for defining and running background jobs in a queued manner thenetworg/oauth2-azure v1.4.2 Azure Active Directory OAuth 2.0 Client Provider for The PHP League OAuth2-Client unclecheese/display-logic 2.0.2 Allows assignment of conditions for display and hide of specific form fields based on client side behavior. ## Description SilverStripe is still using Order, Deny, Allow directives in .htaccess files. This was deprecated with the release of Apache 2.4 and has finally been removed as of 2.4.39 causing SilverStripe to no longer work. https://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/howto/access.html https://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/upgrading.html ## Steps to Reproduce Run SilverStripe with Apache 2.4.39 or later. post:
Waiting for Model.hasMany('relationship').value() to not be null

Hey Ember Data folks, Currently on Ember 2.17 and I'm running into an issue where I've made a call using Ember Data to fetch a model with an include for relationships. For example, if I had a model Employee with a relationship hasMany to other employees in a property called directReports and using the data method to cache relationships  Then when I try to access the direct reports relationship through reference  It's null, which I think is weird because the relationship should have already been included in the response for the query above. I'm suspecting because the relation models are loaded asynchronously even if they have been side loaded with an include. However, if I do something like create a delayed function and set it for something like 200ms later, then employee.hasMany('directReports').value() will return the directReports. However, at that point my route's model hook would have already resolved. Another option I tried was to use  But this seems to make an additional api call. My question has two parts: 1. Should the reference really need to be loading if it was already included in the api response that returned the query for the employee 2. Is there a way to wait for the reference to stop loading and get the value in some kind of promise without using .load() since that seems to make an additional api request?
question: Why not await employee.get('directReports') ?
answer: I'm suspecting because the relation models are loaded asynchronously even if they have been side loaded with an include. However, at that point my route's model hook would have already resolved. ion has two parts: 1. Should the reference really need to be loading if it was already included in the api response that returned the query for the employee 2. Is there a way to wait for the reference to stop loading and get the value in some kind of promise without using .load() since that seems to make an additional api request

post:
Slope walking speed calculation is not accurate

The current rule for slope calculation does not seem to be usable. Costs do not make sense, and positive and negative slopes are treated the same. We have proposed a new way to calculate slope costs, that center around -8% slope (fastest) and then increases exponentially for both positive and negative slopes around this point. EDIT: The linked pull request uses a simpler exponential algorithm with has cutoffs at 1.0 (for neutral and negative slopes) and 3.
question: Should there be any cutoffs? **Relevant information** - https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Naismith%27s_rule - https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tobler%27s_hiking_function - http://mtntactical.com/research/walking-uphill-10-grade-cuts-speed-13not-12/
answer: EDIT: The linked pull request uses a simpler exponential algorithm with has cutoffs at 1.0 (for neutral and negative slopes) and 3.

post:
[Feature Request] Add conditional control statements to kakscript

I think some more control statments should be added to kakscript. In particular, I see a use case for conditionals, such as if; elif; else. This isn't terribly important, but I think it would be useful. #### Rationale In some pluggins I have seen, there are shell expansions solely for the purpose of a conditional operation, which is a performance drop over a native kakscript if statement. For operations that are run infrequently (which are most), the performance cost of calling the shell isn't a problem. But for some things, such as RawKey hooks, there is a noticeable performance impact if shell expansions are involved. ##### Admissions I'll admit, many things in in kakscript won't need native conditional logic, since they'll be calling the shell anyway for some other purpose. That, and the performance impact is small enough (order of 1ms) that in most situations this is a non-issue. But for situations where conditional logic is all that is needed -- such as settings in plugins -- it seems like a waste to call the shell just for that. #### Proposal Add bash-style conditional statments as kakscript commands: if, then, elif, else, and fi. Each would accept one argument (except fi accepts no args): if and elif would accept an expansion that evaluates to true or false. then and else would accept an expansion of commands to evaluate. if and elif would do nothing if true (allowing the following then statement to execute), and if false raise a flag that the next then statement would do nothing. This skip_then flag would be set by if/elif, and reset by then. Another skip_conditional flag would be set by if/elif, and if true would cause any elif, then, or else statment to do nothing. This would be reset by the fi statment.
question: How noticable in the performance impact of using a shell on RawKey hooks? Is it in ms? tens of ms? or even hundreds?
answer: ##### Admissions e. That, and the performance impact is small enough (order of 1ms) that in most situations this is a non-issu

For the entrypoint url parameter that we generate and send to FxA servers, please use the following standard format: domain-point_of_CTA. Examples from our existing site:  We may add other entrypoints later. 2. For datalayer values in FxA links, please use the following standard format ([ref](https://bedrock.readthedocs.io/en/latest/analytics.html?highlight=data-link-type)): FxA-ServiceName. post:
Update and relaunch Browser Comparison Pages

## Description We need to update the browser comparison pages to the current release of each competitor and reflect the latest features in them. We should update the copy in each page as specified in copy docs. Here is the latest [comparison table](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1dyxx-M27jpit4RKStXxR54kkBN1sa9Tbca2a8MionKc/edit#gid=1512926430) vetted by PMM (Tyler Ahn) Here is a[ listing of links](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1UrSn0qR24sI6cdhNVF2fri3aAQr5YdNC2l6DvvSUeIQ/edit#gid=0) to all the things germane to this work We should go in this order: * Update all the browser-specific pages * Update the main page * Relaunch the content * (Migrate to Fluent) * Build additional pages (e.g. Brave) Link to [decisions document](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1bOQV23eZDI7AFaRISv9w-fEH3ZPG8KDKk10dLN-QTiI/edit) --- #### Success Criteria - [ ] Content is updated & browser versions are prominent #### Approvals - [ ] (C) Product: Arthur Edelstein for PrivSec sections - [ ] (C) Product: Rachel Tublitz & Romain Testard for utility & portability sections - [ ] (C) - Brand Design: Clio - [ ] (C) - Brand Copy: Natalie - [ ] (C) - PMM: TBD - [ ] (R) - Websites Team Lead: Hoosteeno - [ ] (A) - TBD
question: How long until we have copy to code? We need to understand timing because our Fluent l10n system is coming online in 2 weeks.
answer: Link to [decisions document](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1bOQV23eZDI7AFaRISv9w-fEH3ZPG8KDKk10dLN-QTiI/edit)

post:
ImportError: No module named 'skimage' when pip install scikit-image

## Update I finally solved it by downgrading scikit-image to 0.14.1 (have to downgrade numpy to previous version 1.15.4 and so as other related packages). Maybe this is caused by python 3.4? I'm not quite sure, since I have another machine with Ubuntu 16.04 and python 3.5, everything works fine for the same code. ## Description I'm using ubuntu 14.04, virtualenv with python 3.4, when pip install scikit-image, gives following error. Not sure why, I can install 0.14.1 version, but have to downgrade numpy which cause a lot of issues because of other packages.  ## Way to reproduce [If reporting a bug, please include the following important information:] - [ ] Code example - [ ] Relevant images (if any) - [x] Operating system and version - ubuntu 14.04 - [x] Python version - 3.4 - [x] scikit-image version (run skimage.__version__) 0.14.2
question: Might be new pip, forbidding putting source path on path for build? See discussion at: https://github.com/pypa/pip/issues/6163
answer: ## Update I finally solved it by downgrading scikit-image to 0.14.1 (have to downgrade numpy to previous version 1.15.4 and so as other related packages). Maybe this is caused by python 3.4? I'm not quite sure, since I have another machine with Ubuntu 16.04 and python 3.5, everything works fine for the same code.

exposure.equalize_adapthist changes output datatype

* **[ORIGINAL TITLE] Setting clip-limit to 1 does not return original image.** ## Description In the _clahe function, it says setting the clip limit to one will return the original image. That is not true because before it is passed through to that function, clip limit is multiplied by "nbins".
question: Could you please send us some code exemplifying it? We will try to reproduce based on that. Thanks again!
answer: * **[ORIGINAL TITLE] Setting clip-limit to 1 does not return original image.**

post:
[Feature Request] better description for audio filters

Update: More Information for users seems to be the preferred option. **Potencial Implementation List:** - [x] Add info to the [wiki page about Audio](https://wiki.mumble.info/wiki/Audio): * (partly done) What audio filters are included * (partly done) Usecases (aka when are they useful) * (partly done) configuration options * (partly done) How to enable/disable them * How do they perform quality-wise (imo some are better, for example webrtc (can be activated in pulseaudio)) * (partly done) note about conflict with external audio filters - [ ] add info icon next to the echo cancel-/audio filter- options: * short description * link to wiki * (maybe) notice about conflict with external audio filters - [ ] add section to new startup wizard about audio filters * short description * short options; enable/disable * link to wiki ------------------------------------------------------------------------ **Original Report** **Title:** Check for external audio filters **Context:** Audio filters **Description:** Check if external audio filters (like echo cancel) are already in use (e.g. in pulseaudio) and show that in the UI. **Alternatives:** * Explain to users (maybe only at first start), that mumble has implemented audio filters (also which) and that they might disable them if they use filters otherwise. * Maybe only advanced users use such a scenario and will know what to do. **Additional Info:** In some applications the overlapping use of audio filters can have distorting, disturbing & repealing effects. * Implementation Details: * Of course mumble might not be able to check for every possible software that includes audio filters, but at least it could check for some, including: * pulseaudio * pulseeffects * Whether audio filters are enabled might be already visible in the names of sink and source, so mumble could just check the names.
question: How would you detect active pa modules / audio filters? sink or source name might be very unreliable. If it's no 100% reliable it's worse than doing nothing (IMHO).
answer: ------------------------------------------------------------ More Information for users seems to be the preferred option. **Potencial Implementation List:** - [ ] Add wiki page about Audio Filters (especially echo cancel): * What audio filters are included * Usecases (aka when are they useful) * configuration options * How to enable/disable them * How do they perform quality-wise (imo some are better, for example webrtc (can be activated in pulseaudio)) * note about conflict with external audio filters - [ ] add info icon next to the echo cancel-/audio filter- options: * short description * link to wiki * (maybe) notice about conflict with external audio filters - [ ] add section to new startup wizard about audio filters * short description * short options; enable/disable * link to wiki

post:
Power Save display sleep (no signal) does not work if screensaver is also used, it used to work.

## Bug report ### Describe the bug First goto settings / interface / screensaver / set screensaver mode dim, wait time 1 minute. Next go to settings / system / power saving / set put display to sleep when idle, set to 5 minutes. ## Expected Behavior The screensaver should dim at 1minute, then at 5 minutes the display should go into "no signal mode" allowing the tv to power off according to your tv "no signal" settings (mine is set to turn off after 15 minutes of no signal.) ## Actual Behavior The screen does not go into "no signal mode" at the 5 minute mark, instead it goes blank for a second, like it tried, but then goes back to the dim screensaver, and stays on indefinitely. ## Possible Fix Currently if you set Screensaver to "none" instead of dim, the power saving feature will work. So I believe the Screensaver may be the culprit. Furthermore this worked properly under Kodi 17. ### Your Environment Used Operating system: - Linux, Ubuntu 18.04 with Kde Plasma - Kodi version: 18 beta5 / latest ### Debug log [https://paste.kodi.tv/zuxahinoni.kodi](https://paste.kodi.tv/zuxahinoni.kodi)

myvideos113.season_view and tvshow_view not ANSI 92 compliant and therefore broken

<!--- Please fill out this template to the best of your ability. You can always edit this issue once you have created it. --> <!--- Read the following link before you create a new problem report: https://kodi.wiki/view/HOW-TO:Submit_a_bug_report --> ## Bug report ### Describe the bug Here is a clear and concise description of what the problem is: <!--- Provide a more detailed introduction to the issue itself, and why you consider it to be a bug --> <!--- A bug report that is not clear will be closed --> <!--- Put your text below this line --> myvideos113.season_view and tvshow_view not ANSI 92 compliant as it includes group by clause without all the selected fields in the select statement. Therefore any normal ANSI 92 compliant RDBMS such as MySQL 5.7 fails to create the view succesfully. ## Expected Behavior Succesfully create the view and be able to select from it ## Actual Behavior It errors out: SELECT list is not in GROUP BY clause ERROR MySQL ## Possible Fix View definition should change as follows: select myvideos113.seasons.idSeason AS idSeason,myvideos113.seasons.idShow AS idShow,myvideos113.seasons.season AS season, myvideos113.seasons.name AS name,myvideos113.seasons.userrating AS userrating,tvshow_view.strPath AS strPath, tvshow_view.c00 AS showTitle,tvshow_view.c01 AS plot,tvshow_view.c05 AS premiered,tvshow_view.c08 AS genre, tvshow_view.c14 AS studio,tvshow_view.c13 AS mpaa, count(distinct myvideos113.episode.idEpisode) AS episodes, count(myvideos113.files.playCount) AS playCount, min(myvideos113.episode.c05) AS aired from (((myvideos113.seasons join myvideos113.tvshow_view on((tvshow_view.idShow = myvideos113.seasons.idShow))) join myvideos113.episode on(((myvideos113.episode.idShow = myvideos113.seasons.idShow) and (myvideos113.episode.c12 = myvideos113.seasons.season)))) join myvideos113.files on((myvideos113.files.idFile = myvideos113.episode.idFile))) group by myvideos113.seasons.idSeason,myvideos113.seasons.idShow,myvideos113.seasons.season,myvideos113.seasons.name, myvideos113.seasons.userrating,tvshow_view.strPath,tvshow_view.c00,tvshow_view.c01,tvshow_view.c05,tvshow_view.c08, tvshow_view.c14,tvshow_view.c13; tvshow_view: GROUP BY clause should be eliminated. There is no need for GROUP BY clause as there is no agregate function in the SELECT clause. OR Rewrite select statement to include full GROUP BY clause, i.e. as follows: select myvideos113.tvshow.idShow AS idShow,myvideos113.tvshow.c00 AS c00,myvideos113.tvshow.c01 AS c01, post:
PVR: regression: Wrong channel numbers in groups

<!--- Please fill out this template to the best of your ability. You can always edit this issue once you have created it. --> <!--- Read the following link before you create a new problem report: https://kodi.wiki/view/HOW-TO:Submit_a_bug_report --> ## Bug report ### Describe the bug <!--- Provide a more detailed introduction to the issue itself, and why you consider it to be a bug --> <!--- A bug report that is not clear will be closed --> <!--- Put your text below this line --> Channels have the same numbers in all groups. There is no way to set them for any group (other than All Channels). ## Expected Behavior <!--- Tell us what should happen --> <!--- Put your text below this line --> There should be a way to set channel numbers for groups independently. That behavior was in Krypton. In Group Manager, channel were added to the end of the group and take sequential numbers, starting from 1. That way user could manage channel numbers in groups. ## Actual Behavior <!--- Tell us what happens instead --> <!--- Put your text below this line --> Wherever channel is added to the group in Group Manager, it keeps it's number and position from All Channels group and there is no way to change it. ## Possible Fix <!--- Not obligatory, but suggest a fix or reason for the bug --> <!--- Put your text below this line --> Restore previous behavior. At least, make it optional. ### To Reproduce Steps to reproduce the behavior: <!--- Provide a link to a live example, or an unambiguous set of steps to --> <!--- reproduce this bug. Include code to reproduce, if relevant --> <!--- Put your text below this line --> 1. Install any PVR addon, e.g PVR Demo. 2. in [Settings/TV/General](https://kodi.wiki/view/Settings/TV/General), TURN OFF both options below: - [Use channel order from backend(s)]( https://kodi.wiki/view/Settings/TV/General#Use_channel_order_from_the_backend.28s.29) - [Use channels number from backend](https://kodi.wiki/view/Settings/TV/General#Use_channels_number_from_backend) 3. Go to [Group manager](https://kodi.wiki/view/Settings/TV/General#Group_manager), add some random channels to any group. 4. The channels get added with the same numbers and order they had in "All Channels" group (effectively, when they were ungrouped). There is no way to change that. (see screenshots) ### Debuglog <!--- Put your text below this line --> <!--- A debuglog is always mandatory when creating an issue. Provide one! --> The debuglog can be found here: http://sprunge.us/yqaXZw ### Screenshots <!--- Put your text below this line --> Leia, wrong numbering in Group #3 ![screenshot000](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/233979/73853379-ce556b00-4841-11ea-9a35-7a3ceaf1c874.png) Krypton, right numbering ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/233979/73857006-54c07b80-4847-11ea-883f-6180930501e1.png) ## Additional context or screenshots (if appropriate) <!--- How has this bug affected you? What were you trying to accomplish? --> <!--- Put your text below this line --> If group's channel numbers are changed in the database directly (from external program), they are overwritten by Kodi with those fake numbers. So the user's data from e.g previous Kodi version are just lost. #16593 ### Your Environment Used Operating system: <!--- Include as many relevant details about the environment you experienced the bug in --> <!--- Put your text below this line. Checkboxes can easily be ticked once issue is created --> - [x] Android - [ ] iOS - [x] Linux - [ ] OSX - [ ] Raspberry-Pi - [ ] Windows - [ ] Windows UWP - Operating system version/name: - Kodi version: Leia <!--- End of this issue --> @ksooo @phunkyfish @Leatherface75

post:
Interpolating points to grid with writers.gdal IDW produced unexpected results

While using writers.gdal to interpolate a raster from four points, we encountered some unexpected behaviour. Together, these issues cause IDW in writers.gdal to function very differently to IDW implemented in other geospatial software (e.g. ArcGIS, QGIS, Surfer). 1. Values were only returned for cells in columns or rows containing at least one point, resulting in holes in the raster. We expected a continuous surface across the entire area, bounded by Xmax/Xmin and Ymax/Ymin. This behaviour appears to be independent of the radius argument, as this parameter was set much higher (~10) than the actual distance between points (~1). This issue probably only appears when resolution is lower than point spacing. 2. Interpolation only actually happened for cells lying on an intersection of rows or columns containing two or more points. In columns or rows containing a single point, all cells have the exactly the same value as the point. This is not how spatial interpolation should work, and results in artificial striping of the resultant raster. 3. Implementations of IDW normally take a ‘power’ argument, to control the distance weighting. There does not appear to be an argument for power in writers.gdal. This restricts the way in which this points-to-grid function can be employed and tuned to specific applications. _Example output raster, with four point locations shown as black dots._ ![screen](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25197948/58557512-74ae9280-8216-11e9-89fb-6a71c03225cc.png) _Code used:_ (tested on Windows, PDAL v1.9.0) dtm_pipeline = { "pipeline": [ { "type": "readers.text", "filename": input_file, "skip": 1, "spatialreference": EPSG }, { "type": "writers.gdal", "dimension": "Z", "resolution": 0.1, "radius": 10, "output_type": "idw", "gdaldriver": "GTiff", "filename": dtm_outfile } ] }
question: Can you please provide the input file?
answer: . This issue probably only appears when resolution is lower than point spacing

post:
separate security for control and status actions

**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.** Authentication for control and status actions in Puma::App::Status is implemented via the same control-token option, while the security requirements related to control actions like halt and status actionsstats differ significantly. **Describe the solution you'd like** ~~Separate tokens for control and status actions.~~ Eliminate the need for a token to access status actions, reserving it for control actions. **Describe alternatives you've considered** An option to set the authorization level (control | status) for the control-token option. Separate tokens for control and status actions.
question: What if, instead, we allowed you to configure a callback lambda/proc?
answer: ~~ actions.~~ Eliminate the need for a token to access status actions, reserving it for control Separate tokens for control and status actions.

If input dir does not exist, then quit. if not os.path.isdir(adir): print("Input directory does not exist.") sys.exit() # If input dir does not exist, then quit. if not os.path.isdir(hdir): print("Input directory does not exist.") sys.exit() # If output dir does not exist, create it. if not os.path.isdir(odir): print("Creating output directory "+odir+".") os.mkdir(odir) # If there are files in the output dir, then delete all .png files. if os.listdir(odir): print("Output directory is NOT empty.") print("Deleting all .png files.") files = glob.glob(os.path.join(odir,'*.png')) for file in files: print(file) os.remove(file) # Specify file to get coordinates -- ifil=os.path.join(hdir,'hmi.M_45s.20160304_165615_TAI.2.magnetogram.fits') md1=sunpy.map.Map(ifil) #Coordinates for the zoomed-in image x0 = (60) * u.arcsec y0 = 313 * u.arcsec ht = 71 * u.arcsec width = (101) * u.arcsec # Top Right coordinates (tmp top right (wcs), top right (pix)) ttr = SkyCoord(x0+width, y0+ht,frame=md1.coordinate_frame) # Bottom Left coordinates (tmp bottom left (wcs), bottom left (pix)) tbl = SkyCoord(x0, y0,frame=md1.coordinate_frame) # tr = astropy.wcs.utils.skycoord_to_pixel(ttr,md1.wcs)*u.pixel bl = astropy.wcs.utils.skycoord_to_pixel(tbl,md1.wcs)*u.pixel # Start main loop to process files. # Remember "file" is a special word to sunpy print('Starting Main Loop') hfiles = sorted(glob.glob(os.path.join(hdir,'*.fits'))) afiles = sorted(glob.glob(os.path.join(adir,'*.fits'))) tmp1=[] tim=[] # Fix the HMI files # Need special case for 1st data set. tlast needs to be correctly set. hfile0=hfiles[0] md=sunpy.map.Map(hfile0) timprev=md.date sub=md.submap(bl,tr) tmp1.append(sub) tim.append(md.date) # Loop through the rest of the HMI files for ifile in hfiles[1:]: mdh=sunpy.map.Map(ifile) subh=mdh.submap(bl,tr) tmp1.append(subh) # Create Time Array tim.append(subh.date) # Convert subarray list into type MapSequence print('Creating Map Sequence') mch=[] mch=sunpy.map.Map(tmp1, sequence=True) # Fix the AIA files atmp1=[] atim=[] # Need special case for 1st data set. tlast needs to be correctly set. afile0=afiles[0] mda=sunpy.map.Map(afile0) timprev=mda.date sub=mda.submap(bl,tr) atmp1.append(sub) atim.append(mda.date) # Loop through the rest of the AIA files for ifile in afiles[1:]: mda=sunpy.map.Map(ifile) suba=mda.submap(bl,tr) atmp1.append(suba) # Create Time Array atim.append(suba.date) # Convert subarray list into type MapSequence print('Creating Map Sequence') mca=[] mca=sunpy.map.Map(atmp1, sequence=True) # Do the Plot and Save to file # Typical filename: AIA20160303_175155_0304.fits cmap=cm.get_cmap('bwr') norm=colors.Normalize(vmin=-100,vmax=100) anorm=colors.LogNorm(vmin=10,vmax=3000) for i in range(len(mca)): mca[i].plot_settings['norm']=anorm for i in range(len(mch)): mch[i].plot_settings['norm']=norm mch[i].plot_settings['cmap']=cmap # Make the Composite Map and Do the Plot fig, ax = plt.subplots() cmap = sunpy.map.Map(mca, mch, composite=True, alpha=1.0) cmap.set_alpha(1,0.9) cmap.set_levels(1,[-70,-25,25,70],percent=False) # Draw all the contours with thinner lines for i in range(len(cmap)): cs=cmap[i].plot() # The AIA array plt.grid(b=None) # Needed in both places tmp=cs[1] # A tmp file containing the HMI array colors=['b','b','r','r'] for j in range(len(tmp.collections)): zc=tmp.collections[j] plt.setp(zc, linewidth=1.0) plt.setp(zc, color=colors[j]) plt.grid(b=None) plt.colorbar() plt.ylabel('Helioprojective Longitude [pixels]') cmap[i].plot(title="Composite Map\n AIA time " +mca[i].date.strftime('%Y%m %d_%H%M%S')) oname="%s%s_%d_olay.png" % (mca[i].instrument[0:3], mca[i].date.strftime('%Y%m%d_%H%M%S'),mca[i].wavelength.value) fig.savefig(odir+oname) plt.close() print('Done') I am also trying to plot arcsec instead of pixels.

I want to create a pipeline rendering 3D on remote server and visualize locally via Mac XQuartz. But I am new to 3D rendering and openGL. I found VirtualGL a helpful tool to do this, but I met a bug when configuring VirtualGL. I have a Ubuntu 16.04 server with 3 Quadro P5000. I downloaded LINUX X64 (AMD64/EM64T) DISPLAY DRIVER with version number 390.77 I installed several mesa packages  Then I tried  I tried optirun  My display management service is lightdm, so there is no xorg.log. However, I didn't find useful lightdm log in /var/log/lightdm. It looks like a common problem but all solution online are tried without progress. Does anyone knows how to debug it ? **[SOLVED]** I finally make it after several days ! Error: couldn't get an RGB, Double-buffered visual turns out to caused by my local environment. I installed Xquartz and X11 on Mac OSX Sierra but has problem when typing:  I posted issue [here](https://bugs.freedesktop.org/show_bug.cgi?id=107622), which remain unresolved. I switched to Ubuntu 16.04 and follow this [tutorial](https://www.scm.com/doc/Installation/Remote_GUI.html). I installed CUDA 8.0 and its proprietary NVIDIA driver. I fixed a bug of X server in /var/log/Xorg.0.log  with  After restarting lightdm. I can use remote rendering with vglrun glxgears

post:
Item in child collection not being removed

Removing an item from a collection mapped as extra-lazy has sometimes no effect: the item stays in the collection. This happens when the remove is done while the collection is not yet initialized, and if it is enumerated after the remove. In such case, the enumeration not only yields the item, but also at later flush, the item is not deleted from the collection. Corresponding Hibernate issue: https://hibernate.atlassian.net/browse/HHH-5742 Initial report follows: --- Not sure if this is a bug or something I am doing but I have an entity with a child collection, exposed as an IEumerable<> and I am having issues removing the item:  I do the following to remove the item: myChildItem.Parent.RemoveChildItem(myChildItem); If I stick a breakpoint after the _childItems.Remove(item); line then I discover that the _childItems collection still contains the item. I think it has something with initialising the _childItems collection (extra lazy load) because if I add a check before it like: if (!_childItems.Any(c => c == item)) throw new Exception(); then the _childItems.Remove(item); works correctly. Likewise if I put a breakpoint before the remove and inspect the collection (causing it to initialise), then it works.
question: Do you experience any real troubles apart from seeing the removed item in the debugger?
answer: Removing an item from a collection mapped as extra-lazy has sometimes no effect: the item stays in the collection. This happens when the remove is done while the collection is not yet initialized, and if it is enumerated after the remove. In such case, the enumeration not only yields the item, but also at later flush, the item is not deleted from the collection. Initial report follows: ---

Exception:  Mapping (Example.SomeEntity):  There is no ForeignKeyConstraint on Property and ReferencedProperty and both properties are not keys.
question: Which way is it? Does it throw if the referenced entity has the property null, or if the referencing entity has its association null?
answer: exception if the property value (in the database) is null.  c#

post:
Schema auto-update should throw errors

When using the "hbm2ddl.auto" property in a Configuration and then calling Configuration.BuildSessionFactory(), SessionFactoryImpl creates and invokes a SchemaExport. Problem is, any errors/exceptions that come from that SchemaExport execution are ignored by SessionFactoryImpl. There should be a way for them to be exposed to calling code so the application can decide what to do. In fact it seems very _unlikely_ to me that any application that's using auto-update would ever want such errors to be ignored. Perhaps a property on Configuration to at least fail fast if the SchemaExport has anything in its Exceptions property. I can think of more flexible/extensible options, but the ability to make schema update errors a fatal situation would be helpful. Edit: the feature is available in 5.3 through a configuration setting, hbm2ddl.throw_on_update, false by default in 5.3.
question: Can I take this up or is the OP going to handle it himself?
answer: Edit: the feature is available in 5.3 through a configuration setting, hbm2ddl.throw_on_update, false by default in 5.3.

The following script manages to reproduce this on a mac I have access to.
Output

I think the main thing to notice in that whole output, is that when running PyPy 3.6, v7.3.0 from within pytest from within a virtualenv, -m site gives this output: while if I afterwards run the same command outside of pytest, I get: Things to note: - PyPy 2.7 works, PyPy 3.6 not - virtualenv 19 works, virtualenv 20 not - Directly running get-pip.py works, running through pytest not I have not yet tried (but will, now): - Whether this also fails on Linux. - Whether this also fails in a Python 2 virtualenv on macOS. - Whether this also fails when installing a different script than pip with get-pip.py. post: Polish e-Dowód management tool violates OpenSC LGPL license https://github.com/OpenSC/OpenSC/issues/1831#issuecomment-569445040 ## Context In March 2019 Polish governments introduced the new identity card. First Polish identity card with the electronic layer. Also, management application was released, which is the main reason of this issue. [(ref)](#url) ## Copyright infringement At lest one component of the eDo (e-dowod-pkcs11-64.so) looks, smells and acts like derived from OpenSC pkcs11 lib. It can be easily noticed by investigating content of the file, or even by looking into the logs emitted by e-dowod_can([ref](#log)). According to those traces, at least following files were affected: - https://github.com/OpenSC/OpenSC/blob/master/src/libopensc/ctx.c - https://github.com/OpenSC/OpenSC/blob/master/src/libopensc/reader-pcsc.c - https://github.com/OpenSC/OpenSC/blob/master/src/libopensc/cache-client.c There is no information about OpenSC or any other LGPL content used by the application. Eula[(ref)](#eul) states that PWPW (Polish Security Printing Works)[(ref)](#pwp) is the copyright holder of everything. ## My actions I have opened the issue on the official support channel, but I got informed that the source code is the "company secret and can not be revealed"[(ref)](#res). As I'm not holding any copyrights of OpenSC I'm not legit of taking any further actions according to that. ## Appendixes ### e-Dowód URL-s - https://www.gov.pl/web/e-dowod - https://www.gov.pl/pliki/edowod/e-dowod-3.0.27.171.run ### Vendor response ### Fragment of ~./edowod/can.log ### EULA head ### PWPW (Polish Security Printing Works) contact
question: Could you please provide binaries that would clearly show linking of OpenSC code with code that is not published under LGPL-compatible license?
answer: In March 2019 Polish governments introduced the new identity card. First Polish identity card with the electronic layer.

post:
Add support for the ACS ACR101 ICC Reader, used by Certum's Open Source Code Signing program

Hello, and sorry if I am filing this in the wrong place. Certum provides Microsoft Authenticode Code Signing certificates (for signing Microsoft Windows executables and installation packages) to open-source developers at a reduced price. As far as I know, this service is the most affordable way for open-source developers to sign their Windows release binaries. As of a few years ago, due to changes in Microsoft Authenticode policies, Certum only issues code signing certificates on hardware tokens (they sell a bundle which includes a token and a certificate which can be activated online). The token seems to be a ACS ACR101 ICC Reader (USB ID 072f:1204). I am trying to get code signing working on Linux, as it is my main development platform and I can perform all aspects of the Windows builds on it, except for code signing. As I understand, the process would be as follows: 1. A PC/SC driver for the token is needed. I see that the [ACSCCID project](http://acsccid.sourceforge.net/) provides a driver for this token; the manufacturer also seems to [provide some open-source drivers for download](https://www.acs.com.hk/en/products/141/acr101i-simicro-ccid/#downloads). 2. A PC/SC implementation makes the device available to applications using the installed driver. For Linux, that would be pcsclite. 3. OpenSC can talk to the device through the PC/SC daemon, and can export this functionality via an OpenSSL engine. 4. OpenSSL provides the interface for applications wishing to perform cryptographic operations. 5. Finally, the osslsigncode tool [can be used to sign PE files through libp11](https://github.com/mtrojnar/osslsigncode/issues/34#issuecomment-595688457). (Edit: I have since realized that there are two devices involved, the reader and the card, so the above isn't accurate.) Following the [guide on the wiki](https://github.com/OpenSC/OpenSC/wiki/Quick-Start-with-OpenSC) yields:  and, pkcs11-tool shows:  So, if I understand correctly, the missing link is OpenSC's support for this device. I'm happy to help with what I can to aid its inclusion, though unfortunately I'm not well versed in cryptography or hardware tokens.
question: Could you try the changes suggested in https://github.com/OpenSC/OpenSC/pull/2006?
answer: (Edit: I have since realized that there are two devices involved, the reader and the card, so the above isn't accurate.)

post:
Replace @RegisterDefaultEntities with @EntityScan

There is org.springframework.boot.autoconfigure.domain.EntityScan and it should be used instead of org.axonframework.springboot.util.RegisterDefaultEntities. These two annotations serve the same purpose - they specify packages with JPA entities. @EntityScan also may define other entities, like NOSQL documents and natively integrates with Spring.
question: Do you mind elaborating why you see this issue as a necessity, @Sam-Kruglov?
answer: . These two annotations server the same purpose - they specify packages with JPA entities. @EntityScan also may specify other entities, like NOSQL documents and natively integrates with Spring.

post:
Change 6x6x6 and 7x7x7 Round Format to Bo1 (3 Attempts)

Essentially just make it like 3BLD. This is optimal because pops and parities can very easily ruin an average—not to mention that a world-class solver can lose to a 5-minute solver in the final round all because of a DNF from a slice move. Additionally, big cubes are all about adrenaline, so getting three attempts to get a nice solve is perfect for competitions, and especially for major championships. The luck factor for being a Bo3 shouldn't be problematic since three attempts is plenty to show your skill. I think this is the best way to deal with these issues, because making it an Ao5 would probably take too long for many competitions. If there are any downsides to this, let me know EDIT: Forgot to mention—it should go without saying that cutoffs for these events would be abolished. Time limits are enough for scheduling issues
question: How does Bo1 with 3 attempts work?
answer: I think this is the best way to deal with these issues, because making it an Ao5 would probably take too long for many competitions.

post:
Environment variable for limiting the number of JOBS [Again]

Is it possible to finally add the support for an environment variable that would limit the maximum number of jobs ninja can spawn? I would suggest having an optional environment variable NINJA_NUM_JOBS, which would be used as an initial value when provided. This variable will be parsed before command line arguments that could of course override it. I'm not asking for "additional flags" support [https://github.com/ninja-build/ninja/pull/1399], just a way to override the initial guess of the number of jobs as I understand the concerns behind NINJA_FLAGS and I understand that it might never get accepted. I'm proposing a small change like this:
question: Why not?
answer: I would suggest having an optional environment variable NUwhich would be used as an initial value when provided. This variable will be parsed before command line arguments that could of course override it. I'm not asking for "additional flags" support [https://github.com/ninja-build/ninja/pull/1399], just a way to override the initial guess of the number of jobs as I understand the concerns behind FLAGS and I understand that it might never get accepted. I'm proposing a small change like this: c++ int GuessNUJOBS"); // or any better name. if (s) { // Not a real function if (

Inserts into varbinary(max) col with FILESTREAM or reads from that column takes 10's of seconds

For some reason, inserts into varbinary(max) col with FILESTREAM or reads from that column takes 10's of seconds with tedious. I took the time to trace the bottle neck in my node application back to tedious. I tested the following query using **roughly two 25MB files**. select * from documents where file_extension = 'zip' **MSSQL Management Studio** ![Screen Shot 2019-09-18 at 1 49 36 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16583147/65177178-d2602800-da1b-11e9-89c6-8bbad31b0818.png) **Chrome Dev Tools** ![Screen Shot 2019-09-18 at 1 53 16 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16583147/65177179-d2602800-da1b-11e9-8206-6c0d19666991.png) **Code snippet (not complete)** [tedious-snippet.txt](https://github.com/tediousjs/tedious/files/3636518/tedious-snippet.txt)
question: What are your thoughts @arthurschreiber, @MichaelSun90 ?
answer: **Code snippet (not complete)** let query: string =  INSERT INTO documents (feat_obj_uid, document, file_name, file_extension, file_size) VALUES (@feat_obj_uid, convert(varbinary(MAX), @document), @file_name, @file_extension, @file_size) ; // Defined as any instead of ISQLRequest so that we can add the execute function below and not have to check // if it exists every time before use. const request: any = new tedious.Request( query, (error: any): void => { if (error) { console.log(error); } } ); const document: string =   ; request.addParameter(feat_obj_uid, TYPES.NChar, feat_obj_uid); request.addParameter(document, TYPES.NVarChar, document); request.addParameter(file_name, TYPES.NVarChar, file_name); request.addParameter(file_extension, TYPES.NVarChar, file_extension); request.addParameter(file_size, TYPES.BigInt, file_size); request.execSql();

After some usage, cannot change documents anymore

In Moto Z² Play with a French interface, specifically MorphGNT and Real Strong’s, the β release ceases being able to change documents. One can select other Bible texts but the text itself does not change. To reproduce: Note: in the setting the "open links in spec window" must be checked. 1) Show Strongs numbers in some version of Bible and click a Strongs link, Special window opens, 2) scroll in Special window (dictionary definition window) so that it is active and has a click X button to close but Do not touch the active Bible window 3) from the top menu bar try to change to another Bible version, and it's not changing. Side note: In this bug I found, once you touch the active window to scroll or something, you can change document again.
question: Could you give us the exact steps in how to reproduce the issue?
answer: To reproduce: Note: in the setting the "open links in spec window" must be checked. Show Strongs numbers in some version of Bible and click a Strongs linkSpecial window opens, scroll in Special window (dictionary definition window) so that it is active and click X button to close.Do not touch the active Bible window now, instead try to change the active document to another Bible version or something, and it's not changing. Side note: In this bug I found, once you touch the active window to scroll or something, you can change document again.

post:
[RFC] OpenOCD HLA interface driver for Blackmagic

I've created initial implementation for Blackmagic firmware and implemented a basic OpenOCD HLA interface driver for blackmagic probe. On the probe itself, I've extended the remote.c interface with a new class REMOTE_HL_PACKET. It's currently in experimental stage, but seems to pass functional tests: eg. single stepping, flashing, RTOS threads support, openocd built in memory transfer tests. Speed and performance feel similar to that of st-link. Transfer rate is about 30 KB/s. Half of that of direct gdb connection, but for RTOS support of OpenOCD I think it's a reasonable tradeoff. It enables this workflow:  TODO: - srst reset assertion - JTAG - Trace SWO functionality using libusb - Ability to set serial port / use TCP connection You can find the code on my github: https://github.com/walmis/openocd-blackmagic/blob/master/src/jtag/drivers/blackmagic.c https://github.com/walmis/openocd-blackmagic https://github.com/walmis/blackmagic

post:
undefined method <' for nil:NilClass ranker.rb:215:in rebalance_ranks'

Fixed by https://github.com/mixonic/ranked-model/pull/160 Waiting for new release superior than v0.4.4 ------------------------ Hello, I'm experiencing an issue when changing the scope and sending to the first position at the same time for 2 rows inside a transaction, and I'm suspecting it's because I'm around MIN_RANK_VALUE. I don't know if I'm doing something wrong of if this is a legitimate bug, here's the information I've gathered so far: ### My situation: #### Table creation: t.bigint :row_order, null: false #### Model  #### All rows with scope_1 = 114  ### What I'm doing: Inside a transaction: - Updating 12459 with scope_2 = 18 and row_order_position = :first - Updating 12462 with scope_2 = 18 and row_order_position = :first #### My Code (renamed):  #### The crash The first update (for id: 12459) seems to go through, but the second one fails here: (And then everything gets rolled back)  ### StackTrace <details> <summary>Click to Reveal StackTrace</summary>  </details> ### Gut feeling: I don't have a good grasp of what the gem is trying to accomplish in that method but, it seems like I'm only getting in that method because: - my first update (for id: 12459) must set row_order to be before element id: 12470 (which has row_order -2147483646), so it must end up being -2147483647 or -2147483648. - But now my second update (for id: 12462) must do the same thing, and would probably need row_order -2147483648 or **below** which is the MIN_RANK_VALUE, which probably triggers the call to rebalance_ranks - current_order does not have the current instance so origin is nil, and we get the crash at the comparison => I feel like the fix might be something along the lines of: - pre-adding the current instance to current_order when the scope is changing at the same time. - adding a check on origin.nil? - casting origin.to_i to get nil => 0, or maybe it should take a higher value than destination then? Not quite sure. Anyways I hope this is clear enough and helpful, let me know if you'd like more information or clarification. Thank you 🙏

post:
Sometimes liquibase fails to create DATABASECHANGELOGLOCK table with error 'Specified domain or source column BOOLEAN does not exist' when using Firebird

<!--- This environment context section helps us quickly review your PR. Please take a minute to fill-out this information. --> ## Environment **Liquibase Version**: 3.8.9 **Liquibase Integration & Version**: gradle, spring boot **Liquibase Extension(s) & Version**: N/A **Database Vendor & Version**: Firebird - 2.5.9 **Operating System Type & Version**: Windows 10 ## Description In our project we are trying to upgrade liquibase from 3.5.5 to 3.8.9. Firebird is used as database and the version is 2.5.9. While liquibase is trying to apply the change sets it fails with error: liquibase.command.CommandExecutionException: liquibase.exception.DatabaseException: liquibase.exception.LockException: liquibase.exception.DatabaseException: Dynamic SQL Error; SQL error code = -607; Invalid command; Specified domain or source column BOOLEAN does not exist [SQLState:42000, ISC error code:335544641] [Failed SQL: (335544641) CREATE TABLE DATABASECHANGELOGLOCK (ID INT NOT NULL, LOCKED BOOLEAN NOT NULL, LOCKGRANTED TIMESTAMP, LOCKEDBY VARCHAR(255), CONSTRAINT PK_DATABASECHANGELOGLOCK PRIMARY KEY (ID))] ## Root cause When we dig down the issue, we found that a new Database class Firebird3Database is added. The shortName of this instance is "firebird" which is same with FirebirdDatabase. Now in BooleanType::toDatabaseDataType it is checking whether current database instance is of Firebird3Database, then using BOOLEAN otherwise SMALLINT. This is absolutely correct as Firebird3 supports boolean datatype. But problem is in how liquibase is deciding the current database instance. If we look into the DatabaseFactory it loads all the database classes like: Class<? extends Database>[] classes = ServiceLocator.getInstance().findClasses(Database.class); This will find Firebird3Database and FirebirdDatabase both but this does not guaranty the order. So, in DatabaseFactory::register, it holds only one database instance (if Firebird3Database is found first then Firebird3Database, otherwise FirebirdDatabase) in implementedDatabases as Firebird3Database and FirebirdDatabase both are using same shortName. When liquibase is deciding the database instance from the connection string, it could be Firebird3Database if it is in the implementedDatabases. So, in this case liquibase is sending BOOLEAN though we are using Firebird 2.5.9, and it fails. ## Additional Context Liquibase should use separate shortName for Firebird3Database and FirebirdDatabase so that there could be two instances in implementedDatabases and it should choose Firebird3Database or FirebirdDatabase deciding from the connection string. Thanks ┆Issue is synchronized with this [Jira Bug](https://datical.atlassian.net/browse/LB-204) by [Unito](https://www.unito.io/learn-more)
question: Could you take a look and verify? Thanks, Ronak
answer: ┆Issue is synchronized with this [Jira Bug](https://datical.atlassian.net/browse/LB-204) by [Unito](https://www.unito.io/learn-more)

post:
Redis constructor unavailable

Due to the Redis data constructor not being available to outside users, there is no way to support things like Control.Exception.mask, the "ReaderT design pattern" or any of the unliftio-core tricks or dozens of other calls that could otherwise be compatible with the current API. Please consider exporting this type, even if only in an .Internal module that is clearly labeled as containing dragons. Right now requirements along these lines drives me to either use a private fork, or pay unnecessary channel costs, just to talk back and forth with a dedicated Redis thread, that per force has to be less robust at handling exceptions due to this issue, and I'd like to be able to credit your work and release things publicly. [Edit: no way is apparently hyperbolic here]
question: Would that be enough?
answer: [Edit: no way is apparently hyperbolic here]

post:
Misaligned address for type 'double', in serialization.h, causing runtime error.

I am testing ROS with gcc's ubsan, a sanitizer for detecting undefined behavior. Below is an issue ubsan found in serialization.h. /opt/ros/kinetic/include/ros/serialization.h:234:5: runtime error: store to misaligned address 0x60600000aca4 for type 'double', which requires 8 byte alignment 0x60600000aca4: note: pointer points here 30 00 00 00 be be be be be be be be be be be be be be be be be be be be be be be be be be be be ^ The issue was detected when I tested turtlesim. To reproduce the issue, compile turtlesim with '-fsantize=ubsan. Then, run rosrun turtlesim turtlesim_node in one terminal, and rosrun turtlesim draw_square in another terminal, and then you will get the runtime error and see the message above. Please let me know, if you need more details for reproducing the error message. Many times misalignment is only a minor issue or even by design, but I am not sure if it is the case here, given that the misalignment occurs in the core of ROS.
question: Could this be architecture specific?
answer: gcc's,Let us know if you need more details.
